(Cambridge/Somerville Line,  Inman Sq), 2BR, 3600, Contact info:Kristen Lanni | Advantage Realty | show contact info | show contact info8/1~ Spacious Luxury Unit with Premium Finishes,  Private Patios,  Garage Parking,  and More!Beacon St,  Somerville,  MA 02143$3, 600/moKEY FEATURESSq Footage: 1183 sqft.Bedrooms: 2 BedsBathrooms: 2 BathsParking: 1 GarageLease Duration: 1 Year (See Details Below)Pets Policy: Cats & Dogs OKLaundry: In UnitProperty Type: ApartmentDESCRIPTION*Pictures from another unit in the same building* This stunning luxury property is not to be missed. Overlooking a quiet side street just off Beacon Street on the Cambridge/Somerville line,  this unit is loaded with features and style. This unit boasts several private patio/balcony areas. The unit has around 1200 sf,  gleaming espresso-stained hardwood flooring,  and a generous living area. The chef's kitchen has a great layout with a large island,  stainless steel appliances,  cherry cabinets,  and granite counters. Huge,  open-concept living area offers a fireplace,  separate dining area with french doors to a deck,  a living area,  and an additional nook often used as a study/office area. A hall closet will accommodate a washer and dryer,  and there is also a shared laundry room in the building. The spacious master suite offers a Juliet balcony,  huge master bath with granite tile,  and massive walk in closet. The additional bedroom is spacious and has use of the second full hall bathroom. Excellent layout provides nice separation between living and sleeping spaces. Central heat and air conditioning and crown molding are throughout the unit,  adding a nice touch.Location offers proximity to Harvard and Lesley Universities,  Inman and Dali Squares' renowned restaurants and shops,  plus an approximate 15 minute walk to the Red Line T in either Harvard or Porter Square. Also nearby are Shaw's and Whole Foods Markets.This unit is available August 1st,  and includes one garage parking space. Pets will be considered for this unit. Elevator building offers a lovely lobby,  underground parking,  and a shared laundry facility. Contact me today for a viewing of this and other similar units in the area.Advantage Realty | Kristen Lanni | show contact info | show contact infoWhen responding,  please tell me when you are available to see apartments in the next few days. description: ), 2BR, 2100, This two-bedroom apartment near the N Harvard St/ Western Ave intersection is available for a late May or June 1st move-in. The three current tenants (me,  my partner,  and our roommate) will all move out by May's end.The apartment is in the very quiet neighborhood of Lower Allston. close to several grocery stores,  restaurants in the Brighton Ave/Commonwealth Ave area. There is a stop for Bus 66 at the end of the street and stops for the 70,  70A,  86. 64,  503 are within a 3 minute walk; the Harvard Ave Green B line is about a 10-12 minute walk away.The apartment itself is very cozy,  with ample space for several pieces of furniture in the living room,  dining room,  and kitchen. The living room has a small closet space and a small space next to the front entrance where we placed a large armoire for coats,  shoes,  etc. - its not visible in the living room photo.The two bedrooms are the same size and they fit a full/queen bed with space for a drawer,  a small desk and a nightstand. The closest bedroom to the front entrance has two doors; we keep one locked and use the one across from the bathroom for convenience. The closet space is small,  but there's enough space in the apartment (including the cellar) to store additional items.The kitchen is very large with lots of counter space. It comes with a fridge and dishwasher. We don't tend to use the dishwasher as its not a new model and feel its water-inefficient. There's no word from the landlord on whether they plan to update it,  but we would be more than happy to ask about this. There's also a washer/dryer downstairs you can use,  and a laundromat 3 minutes away if you'd rather wash clothes there.The apartment includes a front and back balcony,  and a small backyard area. Its a very nice set up for warmer months because you can easily barbecue and host gatherings without feeling cramped. The landlords don't mind parties,  but please - keep them civil. We also have some basic furniture available for cheap (some armoires,  a dresser,  a full size bed an boxspring) if you are interested.There's free street parking along the street and adjoining ones (some are permit parking,  though - it's a weird set up).The landlord is looking ONLY for long-term tenants - move in by end of May to sublet for June and July,  and sign a full-year's lease (August 1 2016 - July 31st 2017). Either two or three people can move in - either two room mates,  one couple,  or a couple and an additional roommate. You heard right,  folks - couples are welcome! Our current arrangement is couple + roommate; it's very comfortable and we never feel we invade each other's space.Rent (includes only water; tenants pay for heating,  electricity,  and internet) will consist of the following (NOTE: If you move in before June 1st we will pro-rate according to your move-in date):June & July 2016 - $2100 ($700 each if 3 tenants)August 2016 - July 2017 - $2250 ($150 rent increase,  so $750 each if 3 tenants)The rent is split equally among us as the landlord prefers it that way (to be fair) but for a couple + roommate situation,  you may be able to calculate shares based on square footage (the single person would pay more in this case) - you would need to discuss this directly with the landlord.Send me a message with preferred viewing times and a short description about you. Thank you!

description: + luxury + Harvard/MIT! (Cambridge), 1BR, 2000, This is a modern,  spacious,  light-filled penthouse apartment on the the 10th floor of a professionally managed high-rise building. The floor to ceiling windows in both the living room and bedroom offer ample natural light as well as impressive views over University Park and the city of Cambridge.There is one bedroom and two full baths. The master bedroom is large with an ensuite bathroom and walk-in closet. The luxury Simmons Beautyrest queen-sized bed is very comfortable. There is an air mattress available that can be set up in the large living room should you have an additional 1-2 guests. The full-size kitchen is furnished with all the appliances,  dishes,  and cookware you could need. There is a dining area as well that seats 4.Managed parking (fees apply) is available at the building. Alternatively,  metered parking is available from 8:00am to 6:00pm (with free overnight parking from 6pm - 8am).Lastly,  we only use eco-friendly,  non-toxic bath,  body and cleaning products.Interaction with GuestsWe will be available via email/text/phone.The NeighborhoodCentral Square,  one of Massachusetts' 'Cultural Districts, ' is known for its wide variety of global cuisine,  bars,  live music and theatre venues. It's a vibrant neighborhood that offers direct (and quick!) subway,  bus and pedestrian access to downtown Boston as well as to Harvard Square and MIT.Getting AroundOur apartment is perfectly situated on a quiet side street,  but it's still very close to the action!- 5 minute walk to Central Square (MBTA subway access,  restaurants,  nightlife)- 3 major grocery stores within a 5 minute walk (Star Market,  H-Mart,  Harvest)- 5 minute walk to MIT- 12 minute walk to the Charles River and the Massachusetts Ave Bridge- 15 minute walk to Boston's Back Bay,  Newbury Street and Esplanade- 12 minutes (one subway stop) to Harvard Square- 2-3 minute drive to Whole Foods- Within a 5 minute walk there are some fantastic cafes (Flour and Cafe Luna),  an awesome ice cream shop (Toscanini's) and a few of our favorite restaurants and bars (Craigie on Main,  Cuchi Cuchi,  Clover,  Veggie Galaxy,  Life Alive and Naco Taco). You can find everything from Indian to Thai,  Chinese,  Mediterranean,  Japanese,  Middle Eastern,  vegetarian and vegan...all within a 5 minute walk!Other Things to NoteThere is a fully equipped gym on the first floor of the building. It has cardio equipment as well as free weights and machines.

The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a large private roof deck in the rear which is dedicated solely to this apartment. A beautiful mature oak reaching up from the ground level provides a nice shade in the summer months. This historic preservation balances modern technology with historic preservation. The soaring twelve foot ceilings coupled with the two highly ornate mantles (non-functional),  the plaster crown molding and the flying scrolls provide an uncompromised traditional ambiance. This apartment is the epitome of modern living in a highly ornate historic preservation.Building constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  and has undergone a complete historic preservation conversion. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating system,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. Efficient insulation has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.Located near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. The property is close to several transportation options and there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.The hospital is two blocks away. Downtown and several universities are in the direct vicinity. The building is also located less than ½ mile from the on ramp to I-93 allowing for easy access to regional commuting.Subway Lines and Stops:SILVER - Newton St. (0.37 miles)Bus Routes and Stops:47 - Albany St Opp E Newton St (0.1 miles)10 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT3 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)8 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT1 - 88 E Newton St (0.18 miles)16 - South Bay Mall & Office Max (0.55 miles)Garvens Florusshow contact infoBoston Green Realty LLCprices,  conditions and rental terms are subject to change at any time.

description: ), 1BR, 1800, Our very comfortable one bedroom apartment in South Boston with everything you will need while away from your own home. Bedroom has queen size bed with all linens provided. Kitchen comes fully stocked by two people who love to cook and we have a full dining table for 6. Living room features a decorative fireplace,  exposed brick and built in book shelves for lots of charm but also has a wireless Bose sound system and flat screen TV with basic cable and Apple TV.There are two private decks for you to enjoy. The back deck off of the bedroom has a cute seating area for a couple people. The roof deck allows a big,  relaxing outdoor dinner and beautiful Boston skyline views. Finally,  there is a private washer and dryer in the basement for your use.The apartment is located mere steps from the local 9 bus that will bring you right to the redline train (called the T) or directly into the Back Bay for sight seeing. Many other buses available a couple blocks away that will take you downtown. And remember,  Boston is a very walkable city! If you are coming with a car there is ample free parking on the street and right outside of the apartment.
